p: The perceived lack of defensive resources, including personal protective equipment (PPE), were contributing factors to nurses concerns and fears working during pandemics ( Ives et al., 2009, Kang et al., 2018, Shih et al., 2007, Corley et al., 2010). The uncertainty that the level of protection provided to nursing staff was effective and efficient to minimise infection risk affected many nursesâ€™ ability to cope ( Ives et al., 2009, Corley et al., 2010). Other nurses felt that there was conflicting advice and a lack of consensus on the appropriate infection control measures ( Holroyd and McNaught, 2008). Despite low PPE supplies in some hospitals, nurses demonstrated their resilience by collaborating with colleagues to develop alternative protection, with some using disposable raincoats as PPE ( Shih et al., 2007).
